title: 1908 Olmsted Sketch
creator: John Charles Olmsted
description: In 1908 the nation's premier landscape architects, the Olmsted Brothers of Massachusetts, designed a master plan for Idaho's university, creating a new campus to complement the new Administration Building.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: ca. 1925 Future Development Map
creator: Rudolph Weaver (Moscow, Idaho)
description: Weaver was the chair of the Architecture department and campus architect. He is the architect of record for the Life Science South building.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 1947 Long Range Plan
creator: Victor Jones (Boise, Idaho)
description: Today the Agricultural Science addition and Executive Residence occupy the locations proposed in this plan. Many other elements, however, are significantly different than campus today.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 1955 Long Range Plan
creator: Victor Jones (Seattle, Washington)
description: Many elements of this plan are present in the campus today. Most notably the Swim Center, and PEB are in the locations shown in this plan. The Family Housing on Sweet Avenue is in the location proposed here. Also, the Colleges of Natural Resources and Education are in locations shown as "Instruction" in this plan.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 1971 Planning Study
description: Several buildings in this plan were constructed including the Hartung Theater and College of Law. The ring road and proposed water feature are significantly different than what exists today.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 1997 Illustrative Plan
creator: Gordon Walker
description: Prominent Seattle architect Gordon Walker, a University of Idaho alum, was hired by the office of Capital Planning in the 1990's to serve as a special consultant and advisor in the planning process that led to the current long range campus development plan. Mr. Walker was also the lead designer for the J.A. Albertson College of Business building while working in collaboration with YGH Architects and Design West Architects.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: Long-Range Campus Development Plan: Update 2000 In support of the Strategic Plan
description: Full text LRCDP document with goals, discussion, and objects to provide a detailed frame work for campus planning. Overview written by UofI president Bob Hoover.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 2014 Long Range Campus Development Plan
description: 2014 long range plan reflecting the direction for the campus. Recent projects that are reflected in this plan include the Paradise Creek Ecosystem Restoration and the Stadium Drive Extension project.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 2020-2025 Long Range Campus Development Plan
description: Long Range Campus Development Plan for main campus May 2020 to 2025
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: 2021-2025 Long Range Campus Development Plan
description: Long Range Campus Development Plan for main campus May 2021 to 2025
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan

title: Building Dedications and Date Stones
description: This document contains photos and location descriptions of many of the historic markers on several campus buildings and structures.
source: Architectural and Engineering Services, University of Idaho, https://www.uidaho.edu/infrastructure/facilities/aes/campus-development-plan
